importance_of_sleep: Restores muscle glycogen and supports protein synthesis
Poor sleep increases appetite hormones (ghrelin ↑, leptin ↓), raising fat gain risk

carbohydrates.evidence: Afaghi et al. (2007). High-GI carbs shortened sleep onset latency.

proteins.role: Provides tryptophan, glycine, and neurotransmitter precursors

fats.role: Supports hormones, omega-3 linked with better sleep quality
fats.guideline: Include omega-3 but avoid very high-fat meals late

meal_timing.dinner: 2–3 h before bed: balanced protein + complex carbs + vegetables + healthy fats
meal_timing.pre_bed_snack: 30–60 min before bed: casein protein + tryptophan carb + magnesium-rich food
meal_timing.hydration: Avoid excess fluids right before bed

blue_light_protocol.importance: Blue light suppresses melatonin via circadian signaling
guidelines: If unavoidable: use night shift/blue filter mode
Switch to warm/amber lights instead of bright white LEDs
Do calming activities: journaling, reading, stretching, herbal tea
Get 10–20 min morning sunlight exposure to anchor circadian rhythm
evidence: Cajochen et al. (2011): Evening blue light delays melatonin onset
Burkhart & Phelps (2009): Blue-blocking glasses improve sleep quality

daily_sleep_protocol: Dinner: protein + complex carbs + vegetables + healthy fats
Pre-bed snack: casein protein + tryptophan-rich carb + magnesium-rich food
Include natural melatonin foods (kiwi, tart cherry)
Limit alcohol, sugar, and late-night heavy meals
No screens 1 h before bed or use blue-blockers
Morning sunlight within 30 min of waking
scientific_references: Afaghi A et al. (2007). High-glycemic-index carbohydrate meals shorten sleep onset. Am J Clin Nutr.
Yamadera W et al. (2007). Glycine ingestion improves sleep quality. Sleep Biol Rhythms.
Abbasi B et al. (2012). Magnesium supplementation improves insomnia. J Res Med Sci.
Howatson G et al. (2012). Tart cherry juice improves sleep quality. Eur J Nutr.
Cajochen C et al. (2011). Evening blue light delays melatonin onset. J Appl Physiol.
Burkhart K & Phelps JR (2009). Amber lenses improve sleep. Chronobiol Int.
